summary: An executive order directed the Department of Homeland Security to plan, design, and construct additional barriers along the southwest border in Jan. 2017. Private landowners own a portion of the land that the government needs to construct the barriers. The government purchases pieces of land from willing sellers, or, if that's not possible, acquires the land through a judicial process. The government is working to...
title: Southwest Border: Information on Federal Agencies' Process for Acquiring Private Land for Barriers
